wikipedia_page.main: William Edward Collins (18 February 1867 – 22 March 1911) was an Anglican bishop, Bishop of Gibraltar from 1904 until his death.

link_mentions.page: St. John the Evangelist's Anglican Church, Izmir
response: Constantinople to Smyrna and was subsequently buried in the church.Mason, Arthur James, (1912). Life of William Edward Collins, Bishop of Gibraltar. Longmans, Green.

Inside of the church, the grave of William Edward Collins, Bishop of Gibraltar is on the left of the entrance, to the west. There is a baptismal font next to the grave, in the shape of a seashell, an ancient symbol of Christian pilgrimage. Behind that is the rose window. At the other end of the church, faced by the pews, is the altar, below three of the stained-glass windows.
